body: I have the same issue. I upgraded from 2.89.0

hi @gradha ... you can downgrade by using following command... 

`sudo gem install fastlane -v 2.89.0`

then remove the bad version using... 

`sudo gem uninstall fastlane`

Or if you use `bundler`, you can specify the version like:

```ruby
gem 'fastlane', '2.89.0'
```

then run:

```bash
bundle update fastlane
```

After this, you can remove the version.

I have the same issue with version 2.90.0.

`Looking for related GitHub issues on fastlane/fastlane...

    a minute ago

    https://github.com/fastlane/fastlane/issues/4295 [closed] 22 üí¨
    12 Jan 2017

‚û°Ô∏è  Remove Shenzhen dependency
    https://github.com/fastlane/fastlane/pull/6991 [closed] 19 üí¨
    13 Mar 2017

üîó  You can ‚åò + double-click on links to open them directly in your browser.

issue.title: Fix fastlane crashing when running a lane

repository.name: fastlane
repository.description: üöÄ The easiest way to automate building and releasing your iOS and Android apps

issue.body:
Fixes #12293

I tested this and seems to work, though I don't think that `require` was ever there.

So we've got to figure out what happened and fix it properly. And also why didn't RuboCop missing requires cop didn't catch it.

We could also checkout `2.90.0` and write some failing tests that catch this.

body: A fixed version will hopefully be released soon üöÄ

If I ran `fastlane custom_lane` it worked. Just running `fastlane` crashes though.

> /.fastlane/bin/bundle/lib/ruby/gems/2.2.0/gems/fastlane-2.90.0/fastlane/lib/fastlane/lane_manager.rb:106:in `choose_lane': [!] uninitialized constant Fastlane::LaneManager::Terminal (NameError)

2.91 does not fix for me
"uninitialized constant Terminal"

@zapjonny I'm not ruby programmer, may be something wrong in my code
29 line - UI.message Terminal::Table123

`module Fastlane
  module Actions
    class UnityAction < Action
      def self.run(params)
	    executablePath = params[:executable]
		executablePath["{version}"] = params[:unity_version]
		
        build_cmd = "#{executablePath}"
        build_cmd << " -projectPath #{params[:project_path]}"
        build_cmd << " -batchmode"
        build_cmd << " -quit"
        build_cmd << " -logFile #{params[:log_path]}" if params[:log_path]

        build_cmd << " -nographics" if params[:nographics]

        build_cmd << " -executeMethod #{params[:execute_method]}" if params[:execute_method]

        build_cmd << " -runEditorTests" if params[:run_editor_tests]
        build_cmd << " -resultsFileDirectory=#{params[:results_file_directory]}" if params[:results_file_directory]
        build_cmd << " #{params[:additional_params]}"

        UI.message ""
        UI.message Terminal::Table123
		.new(
          title: "Unity".green,
          headings: ["Option", "Value"],
          rows: params.values
        )
        UI.message ""

        UI.message "Start running"
        UI.message "Check out logs if the build failed"
        UI.message ""

        sh build_cmd

        UI.success "Completed"
      end

      #####################################################
      # @!group Documentation
      #####################################################

      def self.description
        "Run Unity in batch mode"
      end

      def self.available_options
        [
          FastlaneCore::ConfigItem.new(key: :unity_version,
                                       env_name: "FL_UNITY_VERSION",
                                       description: "Version of unity",
                                       default_value: "2017.2.0f3"),
          FastlaneCore::ConfigItem.new(key: :executable,
                                       env_name: "FL_UNITY_EXECUTABLE",
                                       description: "Path for Unity executable",
                                       default_value: "/Applications/Unity_{version}/Unity.app/Contents/MacOS/Unity"),
          FastlaneCore::ConfigItem.new(key: :project_path,
                                       env_name: "FL_UNITY_PROJECT_PATH",
                                       description: "Path for Unity project",
                                       default_value: "#{Dir.pwd}"),

          FastlaneCore::ConfigItem.new(key: :execute_method,
                                       env_name: "FL_UNITY_EXECUTE_METHOD",
                                       description: "Method to execute",
                                       optional: true,
                                       default_value: nil),

          FastlaneCore::ConfigItem.new(key: :nographics,
                                       env_name: "FL_UNITY_NOGRAPHICS",
                                       description: "Initialize graphics device or not",
                                       is_string: false,
                                       default_value: true),

          FastlaneCore::ConfigItem.new(key: :run_editor_tests,
                                       env_name: "FL_UNITY_RUN_EDITOR_TESTS",
                                       description: "Option to run editor tests",
                                       is_string: false,
                                       default_value: false),
          FastlaneCore::ConfigItem.new(key: :results_file_directory,
                                       env_name: "FL_RESULTS_FILE_DIRECTORY",
                                       description: "Path for integration test results",
                                       optional: true,
                                       default_value: nil),
          FastlaneCore::ConfigItem.new(key: :log_path,
                                       env_name: "FL_LOG_FILE",
                                       description: "Path to log file",
                                       optional: true,
                                       default_value: nil),
          FastlaneCore::ConfigItem.new(key: :additional_params,
                                       description: "Additional params to unity",
                                       optional: true,
                                       default_value: "")
        ]
      end

      def self.authors
        ["dddnuts"]
      end

      def self.is_supported?(platform)
        [:ios].include?(platform)
      end
    end
  end
end`
@dimmduh, Try adding `require 'terminal-table'` at the top of your file.

issue.title: uninitialized constant Fastlane::PluginSearch::Terminal crash (again)

repository.name: fastlane
repository.description: üöÄ The easiest way to automate building and releasing your iOS and Android apps

issue.body:
### New Issue Checklist - [x] Updated fastlane to the latest version - [x] I read the [Contribution Guidelines](https://github.com/fastlane/fastlane/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) - [x] I read [docs.fastlane.tools](https://docs.fastlane.tools) - [x] I searched for [existing GitHub issues](https://github.com/fastlane/fastlane/issues) ### Issue Description ``` > fastlane search_plugins junit [‚úî] üöÄ [15:08:51]: Get started using a Gemfile for fastlane https://docs.fastlane.tools/getting-started/ios/setup/#use-a-gemfile [15:08:51]: Looking for fastlane plugins containing 'junit'... Looking for related GitHub issues on fastlane/fastlane... Found no similar issues. To create a new issue, please visit: https://github.com/fastlane/fastlane/issues/new Run `fastlane env` to append the fastlane environment to your issue /Users/itceglevskii/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.0/gems/fastlane-2.97.0/fastlane/lib/fastlane/plugins/plugin_search.rb:33:in `print_plugins': [!] uninitialized constant Fastlane::PluginSearch::Terminal (NameError) from /Users/itceglevskii/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.0/gems/fastlane-2.97.0/fastlane/lib/fastlane/commands_generator.rb:327:in `block (2 levels) in run' from /Users/itceglevskii/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.0/gems/commander-fastlane-4.4.6/lib/commander/command.rb:178:in `call' from /Users/itceglevskii/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.0/gems/commander-fastlane-4.4.6/lib/commander/command.rb:153:in `run' from /Users/itceglevskii/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.0/gems/commander-fastlane-4.4.6/lib/commander/runner.rb:476:in `run_active_command' from /Users/itceglevskii/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.0/gems/fastlane-2.97.0/fastlane_core/lib/fastlane_core/ui/fastlane_runner.rb:75:in `run!' from /Users/itceglevskii/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.0/gems/commander-fastlane-4.4.6/lib/commander/delegates.rb:15:in `run!' from /Users/itceglevskii/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.0/gems/fastlane-2.97.0/fastlane/lib/fastlane/commands_generator.rb:332:in `run' from /Users/itceglevskii/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.0/gems/fastlane-2.97.0/fastlane/lib/fastlane/commands_generator.rb:41:in `start' from /Users/itceglevskii/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.0/gems/fastlane-2.97.0/fastlane/lib/fastlane/cli_tools_distributor.rb:108:in `take_off' from /Users/itceglevskii/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.0/gems/fastlane-2.97.0/bin/fastlane:20:in `' from /Users/itceglevskii/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.0/bin/fastlane:23:in `load' from /Users/itceglevskii/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.0/bin/fastlane:23:in `
' from /Users/itceglevskii/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.0/bin/ruby_executable_hooks:15:in `eval' from /Users/itceglevskii/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.0/bin/ruby_executable_hooks:15:in `
' ``` I found workaround for me: I adopted idea from closed issue https://github.com/fastlane/fastlane/issues/12293#issuecomment-381526050 and added `require 'terminal-table'` to the `/Users/itceglevskii/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.4.0/gems/fastlane-2.97.0/fastlane/lib/fastlane/plugins/plugin_search.rb` It fixes crash: ``` > fastlane search_plugins junit [‚úî] üöÄ [15:25:01]: Get started using a Gemfile for fastlane https://docs.fastlane.tools/getting-started/ios/setup/#use-a-gemfile [15:25:01]: Looking for fastlane plugins containing 'junit'... +--------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------+ | fastlane plugins 'junit' | +--------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------+ | Name | Description | Downloads | +--------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------+ | merge_junit_report | Merges multiple junit reports into one | 19434 | | test_center | This fastlane plugin includes the following actions: | 15760 | | | 1) multi_scan: uses scan to run Xcode tests, optionally in | | skip bottom of table ``` For me it seems like a bug. ##### Complete output when running fastlane, including the stack trace and command used 
fastlane search_plugins junit --capture_output  
[‚úî] üöÄ 
[15:18:54]: Get started using a Gemfile for fastlane https://docs.fastlane.tools/getting-started/ios/setup/#use-a-gemfile

end
